hanzi-su-wiki:
掲

Значения

Высоко поднимать; вывешивать

Мнемоника

Попрошайка 曷 старается, чтобы его рука 扌 была бы хорошо заметна. Вывешивать, реклама, высоко поднимать, публиковать (делать заметным для читателей).

Варианты

揭

Японский вариант 揭

heisig_keyword: put up a notice | поднять объявление
heisig_constituent: put up (a notice), finger, fingers, mexican bandit, muchacho, siesta, sun, day, aroma, bound up, spoon, sitting on the ground
Keyword_KANJIDIC: put up (a notice), put up, hoist, display, hang out, publish, describe
Keyword_KANJIDIC_ru: поставить (уведомление), расфасованные, тали, дисплей, тусоваться, публиковать описания
koohiiStory1: A muchacho puts up a notice that says “NO FINGER SNAPPING ALLOWED. MUCHACHOS ON SIESTA”. The muchachos are sleeping soundly, completely oblivious to the sound of dogs barking, guitar playing and even gun shots. Now imagine one tourist passing by and snapping his fingers and waking up all the muchachos at once.
koohiiStory2: Just as I was finished putting up a "no siestas" notice on my property, a muchacho gave me the finger, sat down, and promptly fell asleep.
jp_example_words:
掲げる(かかげる): to publish, to print, to carry (an article), to put up, to hang out, to hoist, to fly (a sail), to float (a flag)
掲載(けいさい): appearance (e.g. article in paper)
掲示(けいじ): notice, bulletin
WaniKani_Radicals: 扌, 日, 勹, 匕
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: You're in prison, but you can use your fingers and a spoon in the light of the sun to display little moving pictures on your cell wall. It's like a shadow puppet display except you can only make a few characters with your limited hand tools.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Imagine displaying your two favorite characters in the shadows on your prison cell walls. This one is mister fingers and this one is missus spoon. They're best friends.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: There is one thing you display more than anything else and it's cake (けい). You smush your fingers to make a cake shape and use the spoon to pretend you're eating it.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Imagine displaying cake on the wall. Now pretend to eat the shadow cake with your spoon. You can almost taste it. Except you can't, because this is still prison.
Ru_Meaning: put up (a notice), put up, hoist, display, hang out, publish, describe

Kanshudo_mnemonic: in the sun (日) the fragrant (匂) hand (扌) puts up a sign

Chinese Definition:
①］用本义。［例］西柄之揭。——《诗·小雅·大东》。［例］修剑揭以低昂。——张衡《思玄赋》。［例］揭其剑。——《战国策·齐策四》。［例］揭竿为旗——汉·贾谊《过秦论》。［例］两竿夹接。——明·高启《书博鸡者事》。［合］揭厉(高举而扬厉之)；揭鸡肆赦(在高竿上树起金鸡，宣布大赦)。
③肩负；担；扛。［例］负匮揭箧担囊而趋。——《庄子·胠箧》。［合］揭箧(把箱笼扛走；比喻全部抄袭他人文字)。
④披露；发表；公布。［例］会闱揭晓，名次群英。——李昌祺《前灯余话》。［合］揭条(揭桃。揭调，揭露别人的短处)；揭旧书(方言。揭老底)；揭极(揭发恶性的报告)；揭参(揭发弹劾)；揭黄(用黄榜公布)；揭载(刊登；发表)；揭贴(张贴)。
⑤掀起；拿开。［例］揭水指路。——唐·李朝威《柳毅传》。［例］一个客人便去揭开桶盖。——《水浒传》。［合］揭白(旧时人死后，请画师给死人画像。首先要揭去死人脸上蒙的白纸，故名)；揭地掀天(翻天覆地)。
⑥露出；向上翘。［例］颠沛之揭。——《诗·大雅·荡》。［例］唇揭者甚齿塞。——《战国策》。
⑦借债。［合］揭借(借)；揭债(借债)；揭折(抵偿，折还)。

jiē
яп. вм. 揭
Radicals: 扌, 日, 勹, 匕  (fingers, sun, prison, spoon)
Meaning Mnemonic
You're in prison, but you can use your fingers and a spoon in the light of the sun to display little moving pictures on your cell wall. It's like a shadow puppet display except you can only make a few characters with your limited hand tools.
Imagine displaying your two favorite characters in the shadows on your prison cell walls. This one is mister fingers and this one is missus spoon. They're best friends.
Reading Mnemonic
There is one thing you display more than anything else and it's cake (けい). You smush your fingers to make a cake shape and use the spoon to pretend you're eating it.
Imagine displaying cake on the wall. Now pretend to eat the shadow cake with your spoon. You can almost taste it. Except you can't, because this is still prison.
